poem:
**Trade Winds**

Nintendo pauses in mid-sentence,  
its plans held gently  
like a folded origami crane.  
Somewhere, a tariff murmurs,  
whispering through the global corridor  
while distant clouds amass,  
each one checking its watch,  
each one waiting to see  
which way the wind will turn  
and if that origami will take flight  
or flutter back into paper.
